messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 1708
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 12/27/2001 11:34:32 AM Eastern Standard Time, ... Nicki, I really am not sure. . . .I would guess it is more than any one thing or person
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 12/27/2001 11:34:32 AM Eastern Standard Time,
RValvo7626@... writes:


>
>
>

Nicki,

I really am not sure. . . .I would guess it is more than any one thing or
person and more of a over the years they have gotten the sense or feeling
that it is best not to get into it. I think I simply will not tolerate it. .
. it is a known off limits. . . something I project I guess. But also with my
family, anything that is deemed unpleasant or uncomfortable is not talked
about. . . so I would guess that has something to do with it as well.

living in abundance
lovemary

The love that you withhold is the pain that you carry - from lifetime
to lifetime.

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 1708
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 12/27/01 2:40:39 AM Mountain Standard Time, ... But I do believe being brought up w/ a parent who had no confidence in me makes me the
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 12/27/01 2:40:39 AM Mountain Standard Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:


> I couldn't resist this one Nicki! I have a very sarcastic and sometimes
> devilish toungue and my first thought for you to say back to her was:
> 'like you screwed up yours? *devilish smile*
>
> Okay, I know.. its better to hold your toungue than to start an issue..
> BUT sometimes its irresistable!
>
> good luck!
>
> kolleen
>
>
> I bet if I had more of this in me I wouldn't get half as much flack.
But I do believe being brought up w/ a parent who had no confidence in me
makes me the people pleaser that I am. Do as your told ruffle no feathers. I
did try and fight w/ my mother but she was so dominant I never got my point
across. She feels differently.

NICKI~


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 1708
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 12/27/01 2:40:39 AM Mountain Standard Time, ... Is there a way to explain your attitude? I am trying to come across stronger or something to
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 12/27/01 2:40:39 AM Mountain Standard Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:


> My parents are a whole nother story. . . believe me, you wouldnt
> want to hear it. But suffice to say, that because of our attitude, they
> dont
> meddle.
>
> living in abundance
> lovemary
>
>

Is there a way to explain your attitude? I am trying to come across
stronger or something to get family off my back. I don't get their concerns
really. When they speak to my dd or hear stories of what she said etc. she
speaks like and adult at 5. She uses larger words than most kids her age and
correctly. Why are they so damn concerned?

NICKI~
